message.content:
Certainly! Here's a balanced and nutritious meal plan designed to support your overall wellness without specific dietary limitations in mind:

**Breakfast: Avocado Toast with Poached Egg & Mixed Berries - 30 minutes preparation time.**  
- Whole grain bread (2 slices) spread evenly with ripe avocado, topped by a poached egg on each slice of the bread and served alongside mixed berries such as strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries for antioxidants.  
- A glass of fresh orange juice or water (optional).

**Mid-Morning Snack: Greek Yogurt with Honey & Almonds - 5 minutes preparation time.**   
- A cup of plain, unsweetened Greek yogurt served with a drizzle of honey and topped with slivered almonds for healthy fats and protein intake.  
- Fresh cut pineapple or kiwi pieces on the side (optional).

**Lunch: Grilled Chicken Salad - 25 minutes preparation time.**   
- A generous portion of mixed greens such as spinach, arugula and romaine lettuce topped with cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, grilled chicken breast slices (seasoned lightly), a sprinkle of feta cheese or goat cheese.  
- Dressing made from extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste for flavor without excess calories.  
- A piece of whole wheat bread on the side (optional).

**Afternoon Snack: Hummus & Carrot Sticks - 10 minutes preparation time.**   
- Homemade hummus made from chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic and olive oil served with sliced carrots for a crunchy bite full of fiber.  
- A small serving size to keep portion control in mind (optional).

**Dinner: Baked Salmon & Steamed Broccoli - 30 minutes preparation time.**   
- Fresh salmon fillet seasoned with herbs such as dill, lemon zest and a squeeze of fresh lemon juice on top (optional), baked at moderate heat until cooked to your liking.  
- Steamed broccoli florets served alongside for vitamins C and K; you can also steam some baby potatoes if desired.   
- A side salad with mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber slices (optional). 

**Evening Snack: Dark Chocolate & a Cup of Green Tea - Prep time is minimal and enjoyed post meals for relaxation before bedtime.**   
- A couple of squares (30g) of high-quality dark chocolate with at least 70% cocoa content, known to have health benefits when consumed in moderation.  
- Warming up a cup of green tea which can aid digestion and also promote sleepiness due to its natural amino acid L-theanine found within it (optional).

Throughout the day be sure to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water, herbal teas or infusions. This meal plan aims at providing you with balanced nutrients while ensuring that your diet is enjoyable and varied throughout each day!
